H0.text: The mass of the helium is the factor that would most likely increase and cause a helium‑filled balloon to burst as it rises into the atmosphere.

H1.text: The density of the helium would most likely increase as the helium-filled balloon rises into the atmosphere, causing the balloon to burst.

H2.text: The volume of the helium is the factor that would most likely increase as a helium‑filled balloon rises into the atmosphere and cause the balloon to burst.

H3.text: The temperature of the helium is the factor that would most likely increase and cause the helium‑filled balloon to burst as it rises into the atmosphere.

A4.text: As altitude increases, atmospheric pressure decreases.
